result.incident_description: Production API service is completely down. All users are unable to access the application. Error logs show database connection timeout. Started approximately 10 minutes ago.

incident_details.description_summary: Production API service is completely down. All users are unable to access the application. Error logs show database connection timeout. Started approximately 10 minutes ago.

immediate_actions: Verify service status via monitoring dashboards
Check recent deployments or configuration changes
Attempt service restart if safe to do so
Activate incident response team
investigation_steps: Review application logs for errors
Check infrastructure health (CPU, memory, disk)
Verify database connectivity and performance
Check for upstream/downstream service dependencies
mitigation_plan.escalation_criteria: If service not restored within 15 minutes or impact >1000 users

result.final_response:
Incident classification: Critical Service Outage
Affected systems: Production API service
Immediate actions: 
1. Verify service status via monitoring dashboards
2. Check recent deployments or configuration changes
3. Attempt service restart if safe to do so
4. Activate incident response team
Investigation steps: 
1. Review application logs for errors
2. Check infrastructure health (CPU, memory, disk)
3. Verify database connectivity and performance
4. Check for upstream/downstream service dependencies
Escalation criteria: If service not restored within 15 minutes or impact >1000 users

arguments.incident_description: Production API service is completely down. All users are unable to access the application. Error logs show database connection timeout. Started approximately 10 minutes ago.

result.description_summary: Production API service is completely down. All users are unable to access the application. Error logs show database connection timeout. Started approximately 10 minutes ago.

result.escalation_criteria: If service not restored within 15 minutes or impact >1000 users

result.incident_description: Security alert: Unauthorized access detected on admin panel from IP 192.168.1.100. Multiple failed login attempts followed by successful authentication with compromised credentials. Immediate investigation required.

incident_details.description_summary: Security alert: Unauthorized access detected on admin panel from IP 192.168.1.100. Multiple failed login attempts followed by successful authentication with compromised credentials. Immediate investig

immediate_actions: Isolate affected systems from network
Preserve logs and evidence
Notify security team and management immediately
Begin incident response protocol
investigation_steps: Identify attack vector and entry point
Assess scope of compromise
Review access logs and authentication events
Check for data exfiltration or unauthorized access
mitigation_plan.escalation_criteria: Immediate escalation to CISO and legal team

result.final_response:
Incident classification: Security Breach (Critical)
Affected systems: Admin Panel
Immediate actions: 
1. Isolate affected systems from the network
2. Preserve logs and evidence
3. Notify the security team and management immediately
4. Begin incident response protocol
Investigation steps: 
1. Identify the attack vector and entry point
2. Assess the scope of the compromise
3. Review access logs and authentication events
4. Check for data exfiltration or unauthorized access
Escalation criteria: Immediate escalation to CISO and legal team

arguments.incident_description: Security alert: Unauthorized access detected on admin panel from IP 192.168.1.100. Multiple failed login attempts followed by successful authentication with compromised credentials. Immediate investigation required.

result.incident_description: Users reporting slow page load times on the main website. Average response time increased from 200ms to 3000ms over the last 30 minutes. CPU utilization at 85% on web servers.

incident_details.description_summary: Users reporting slow page load times on the main website. Average response time increased from 200ms to 3000ms over the last 30 minutes. CPU utilization at 85% on web servers.

immediate_actions: Monitor current resource utilization
Check for unusual traffic patterns or load
Review recent code or configuration changes
Consider scaling resources if needed
investigation_steps: Analyze application performance metrics
Review slow query logs and database performance
Check for memory leaks or resource exhaustion
Verify CDN and caching layer health
mitigation_plan.escalation_criteria: If degradation persists >30 minutes or worsens

result.final_response:
Incident classification: High severity performance degradation
Affected systems: Web servers
Immediate actions: 
1. Monitor current resource utilization
2. Check for unusual traffic patterns or load
3. Review recent code or configuration changes
4. Consider scaling resources if needed
Investigation steps: 
1. Analyze application performance metrics
2. Review slow query logs and database performance
3. Check for memory leaks or resource exhaustion
4. Verify CDN and caching layer health
Escalation criteria: If degradation persists >30 minutes or worsens

result.incident_description: Database backup job failed last night. Error indicates corrupted data in user_profiles table. Approximately 500 records may be affected. Current database is still operational.

incident_details.description_summary: Database backup job failed last night. Error indicates corrupted data in user_profiles table. Approximately 500 records may be affected. Current database is still operational.

immediate_actions: Stop all write operations if possible
Identify scope and timeframe of data loss
Locate most recent backup
Notify data owners and stakeholders
investigation_steps: Determine root cause of data loss
Verify backup integrity and completeness
Plan restoration procedure
Document affected records or transactions
mitigation_plan.escalation_criteria: Immediate escalation if customer data affected

result.final_response:
Incident classification: Medium severity data loss incident.
Affected systems: Database.
Immediate actions to take: 
1. Stop all write operations if possible.
2. Identify scope and timeframe of data loss.
3. Locate most recent backup.
4. Notify data owners and stakeholders.
Investigation steps: 
1. Determine root cause of data loss.
2. Verify backup integrity and completeness.
3. Plan restoration procedure.
4. Document affected records or transactions.
Escalation criteria: Immediate escalation if customer data is affected.

arguments.incident_description: Database backup job failed last night. Error indicates corrupted data in user_profiles table. Approximately 500 records may be affected. Current database is still operational.

result.incident_description: Intermittent network connectivity issues between application servers and database cluster. Packet loss observed at 15%. DNS resolution working normally. Started 1 hour ago.

incident_details.description_summary: Intermittent network connectivity issues between application servers and database cluster. Packet loss observed at 15%. DNS resolution working normally. Started 1 hour ago.

immediate_actions: Verify network connectivity to critical systems
Check DNS resolution and routing tables
Review firewall and security group rules
Contact network operations team
investigation_steps: Trace network path and identify failure point
Check for ISP or cloud provider incidents
Review recent network configuration changes
Verify BGP routes and peering status

result.final_response:
Incident classification: High severity network issue
Affected systems: Application servers and database cluster
Immediate actions: 
1. Verify network connectivity to critical systems
2. Check DNS resolution and routing tables
3. Review firewall and security group rules
4. Contact network operations team
Investigation steps: 
1. Trace network path and identify failure point
2. Check for ISP or cloud provider incidents
3. Review recent network configuration changes
4. Verify BGP routes and peering status
Escalation criteria: If network unavailable >10 minutes

result.incident_description: Minor UI bug: Submit button on contact form has misaligned text. Functionality works correctly. Only affects visual presentation. No user impact on operations.

incident_details.description_summary: Minor UI bug: Submit button on contact form has misaligned text. Functionality works correctly. Only affects visual presentation. No user impact on operations.

immediate_actions: Identify recent configuration changes
Rollback to last known good configuration
Verify rollback restored functionality
Document the problematic change
investigation_steps: Compare current vs previous configuration
Test configuration in staging environment
Review change approval and validation
Update configuration management procedures
mitigation_plan.escalation_criteria: If rollback unsuccessful or impact unclear

result.final_response:
Incident classification: Low severity, configuration error
Affected systems: Contact form
Immediate actions: 
1. Identify recent configuration changes
2. Rollback to last known good configuration
3. Verify rollback restored functionality
4. Document the problematic change
Investigation steps: 
1. Compare current vs previous configuration
2. Test configuration in staging environment
3. Review change approval and validation
4. Update configuration management procedures
Escalation criteria: If rollback unsuccessful or impact unclear
